Description: Incense burner; cast brass decorated with silver inlay giving the titles of its anonymous Mamluk owner written boldly in Arabic around the body with more traditional blessings around the lid. It would originally have had a long handle but this is missing.
Curator's comments: Originally registered as 13thC this incense-burner is now believed to date to the first half of the 14thC. It is Mamluk but it is not clear whether it was made in Cairo or Damascus.
Bibliographic references: Ward 1990/91 / Incense and incense burners in Mamluk Egypt and Syria (pp.71-72, pl.5)
